comments: Number of symmetric chiral (optically active) isomers possible for organic compounds with n distinct carbon atoms.A020522 interleaved with A004171 and apparently the number of asymmetric Dyck (n+2)-paths with exactly half of the steps lying between the first and last peaks; e.g. all asymmetric 3-paths (UU*DDU*D and U*DUU*DD) comply so a(1)=2. - _David Scambler_, Sep 14 2012
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,2,-4).
maple: f := n -> if n mod 2 = 0 then 2^n-2^(n/2) else 2^n; fi;
author: Paul F. Hudrlik (hudrlik(AT)scs.howard.edu)
extensions: G.f. corrected by Olivier GÃ©rard, Nov 13 2011
